content:
# I have successfully gathered 10 units of iron ore, and my inventory now contains 1 unit of wood, 5 units of stone, and 10 units of iron ore.
# 
# Now, I can proceed to smelt some of this iron ore into iron plates. 
# I will place the stone furnace again and insert the iron ore for smelting, ensuring it has enough wood as fuel.

# First, I will place the stone furnace at the same position.
furnace = place_entity(Prototype.StoneFurnace, position=current_position)  # Placing the furnace again

# Now, I will add wood as fuel and iron ore for smelting into the furnace.
insert_item(Prototype.Wood, furnace, quantity=1)  # Inserting the remaining wood as fuel
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=5)  # Inserting 5 units of iron ore to smelt

# Check inventory after these operations
print(f"Inventory after inserting fuel and ore into the furnace: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Furnace status: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")

# Wait for the smelting process to complete for the next batch of iron plates
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum 30 seconds wait
    plates = inspect_inventory(furnace)[Prototype.IronPlate]
    if plates >= 5:  # Check if 5 iron plates have been produced
        break
    sleep(1)
else:
    raise Exception("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")

# Checking inventory after smelting
print(f"Inventory after smelting: {inspect_inventory()}")
print(f"Furnace status: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")
